job description:
The Arlington Division of Applied Research Associates, Inc. is seeking a Sensor Data Fusion Scientist This position is located in our Arlington, VA office. The candidate will work as part of a multidisciplinary team modeling, analyzing, and combining data from sources spanning quantitative and qualitative domains in support of countering Weapons of Mass Destruction. The successful candidate will help develop algorithms and toolsets to maximize the value of information gained from multiple information sources and deliver tools to a variety of customers.

The individual selected for this position will be expected to work well with high-functioning technical teams, providing technical leadership but also recognizing the importance and value of collaborations across different disciplines. The focus of much of the model development is interdisciplinary in nature, and requires an individual willing to work with persons across a wide range of specializations.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Research: the candidate will support novel tool and data visualization system design. The candidate will also support the design of belief networks to be populated by data from high fidelity models, experiments, human judgment, and open source information. The candidate should have excellent written and communication skills and possess the ability to think outside the box in problem definition, design, and execution of the solution.
  • Project Management: The candidate may be expected to lead the efforts of a team of junior to mid-level scientists and engineers in project execution.
  • Marketing: The candidate will be expected to spend approximately 10% of their time in marketing efforts, including meeting with customers, developing white papers and supporting or leading proposal efforts.
Required Skills:
  • Expertise in Bayesian and Frequentist statistical modeling and inference methods
  • Expertise in estimation theory
  • Significant experience in machine learning techniques
  • Significant experience in open-source data mining and repository tools and visualization systems
  • Expertise in numerical analysis and prototyping-level software such as Matlab, R, Python SciPy stack
Required Experience:
  • B.S. in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
  • 10-12 years of experience in big data analytics applications
  • Experience in working collaboratively with other disciplines to achieve project-level goals
  • Published in scientific journals, with a record of presenting research at scientific conferences and symposia
  • Self-motivated, creative, willing to work as a member of a team, yet organized and able to manage individual schedule
  • Active DoD Secret clearance
Desired Qualifications:
  • M.S. or PhD and 10-15 years’ experience in the above fields
  • Experience in production-level software engineering in Java, C/C++, web development
  • Understanding of modern physics modeling tools and pre- and post-processing of data
  • Experience in machine learning and deep learning
  • Experience with government contracting
  • Active DoD TS/SCI clearance
*ARAClear
